name: Introduction to Philosophy
description: Explore fundamental philosophical questions about existence, morality, and reason.

name: World History Overview
description: A comprehensive look at world civilizations from ancient to modern times.

name: Introduction to Literature
description: Learn how to read, interpret, and analyze literary texts across genres.

name: Art History: Renaissance to Modern
description: Study artistic movements, influential artists, and historical context.

name: Creative Writing Foundations
description: Develop storytelling, poetry, and narrative structure skills.

name: Introduction to Linguistics
description: Study the structure, meaning, and use of language.

name: Ethics and Moral Philosophy
description: Examine moral reasoning and ethical theories applied to real-world issues.

name: Visual Arts and Design
description: Learn principles of design, color theory, and creative composition.

name: Cultural Anthropology
description: Explore human societies, traditions, and belief systems across the world.

name: Music Theory Basics
description: Understand rhythm, harmony, melody, and notation in music.

name: Film Studies: Understanding Cinema
description: Learn how to critically analyze film form, style, and genre.

name: Sociology: Understanding Society
description: Discover how societies are structured and how social interactions shape human behavior.

name: Political Theory and Thought
description: Examine political ideologies and influential thinkers from Plato to modern democracy.

name: Media and Communication Studies
description: Understand how media shapes culture, identity, and public discourse.

name: Modern and Contemporary Art
description: Explore 20th and 21st-century art movements and their cultural impact.
